texts.es: Rene de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz tiene 13 años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, rene se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; en la última siembra no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital,  por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abonos, herbicidas, fertilizante, etc. rene  tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Rene is 45 years old and he lives with his life partner and their three children. He works growing corn and has been working in agriculture for 13 years. He has a lot of experience in the field and is very well-known in the area. He has a good clientele because he gets great results with his harvests. He sells a high-quality product at an affordable price with excellent service. Rene is very friendly. He's an entrepreneur and wants to get ahead. He thinks that taking advantage of opportunities will help him achieve greater success. In his last planting he didn't get the results he expected and now he wants to increase his production but he needs capital. That's why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizer and herbicides. Rene has excellent morals, and is sure that he can repay his loan and also give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Prohors

texts.en: A mother of one child from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Prohors is a farmer who does rice growing and planting as the main source of income. Her two-year engagement in the current business has returned her about 29,000 KHR per day. Prohors is borrowing for the second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has fully repaid her original loan, which has improved her living condition by a good pace already. Now, she is seeking a new loan in amount of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy two sacks of potash, pay for plowing fees, and buy insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will help her to minimize the loss due to pests and to timely boost her crop productivity so that she can receive a high yield and make a good profit.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: A citizen of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Tum is 24 years old and blessed with one small child. Currently, she relies on rice cropping and cassava farming as her main sources of income. Besides helping on the farmland, her husband also works for others for a fee in order to earn extra income. The business has returned her about 30,400 KHR. Tum is new to VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking her first loan in order to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer and pay plowing fees. She hopes that her business will grow in a satisfactory manner so that she can earn a high yield with better income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, vive en casa de su hermano, en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y no tiene hijos. Elizabeth trabaja como secretaria y tambien efectuando la limpieza en uno de los periódicos de la ciudad de La Paz, donde percibe un pequeño sueldo con el cual se mantiene y puede cubrir todas sus necesidades.

El crédito que solicita es para refaccionar la habitación que le dio su hermano para que viva por un buen tiempo, la misma que se encuentra deteriorada en fachada interior. Por el carácter social del crédito, ella califica para uno nuevo.

El sueño de Elizabeth es poder independizarse de la casa de sus su hermano y tener su casa propia.

Esta es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito de IMpro y la cuarta a través dde Kiva.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, lives in a house with her brother in Miraflores in the city of La Paz. She is single and doesn´t have children. Elizabeth works as a secretary and makes from a newspaper in La Paz, where she makes a small living which she uses to care for herself and cover necessary costs.

She requests this loan to remodel the room that her brother gave his brother lets her live in, which is deteriorating in the interior of the building.
Because of the social nature of the loan, she sees it as new. Elizabeth´s dream is to be able to become independent of her brother´s home and have her own home. 

This is the sixth time she requests a loan from IMpro and the fourth through Kiva.

loans.use: to renocate the room where she lives in her brother's house.

loans.name: Jose Modesto

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijas, las cuales tienen edades de 25, 28, 30, 34 y 38 años.  El se dedica a la venta de yuca, ya que la compra, cultiva y vende para obtener ingresos y así aportar a su familia; el oficio lo realiza desde hace 12 años y lo lleva a cabo de lunes a domingo, no ha tenido ningún problema. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar yuca para luego venderla, asimismo para algunos gastos del hogar; este le ayudara  a adquirir mas materia prima y apoyar a su familia.
Su sueño es comprar otro camión y cultivar mas yuca en otro terreno.
texts.en:
José lives with his family of his wife and their daughters who are 25, 28, 30, 34 and 38 years old. He dedicates himself to the sale of cassava, purchasing, growing, and selling it for revenue and thus contributing to his family. He´s been doing this work for 12 years and from Monday to Sunday, has not had any problems.
The loan which he needs will allow him to buy cassava to then sell it, in addition to covering some household expenses; This will help him to buy more raw materials and support his family.
His dream is to buy another truck and grow more cassava in another field.

loans.use: To buy cassava to then sell it, in addition to some household expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide and herbicide.

loans.name: Claudia Lisbeth

texts.es:
Claudia,  solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad  de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y hacerle algunas mejoras a su vivienda; este le permitirá comprar láminas, clavos, entre otros materiales.
El crédito anterior le ayudo, ya que los ingresos aumentaron; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Claudia is asking for a new loan due to the need to keep investing in her business and to do some improvements to her home. The loan will allow her to buy metal sheets and nails, among other materials.

The previous loan helped her, as her earnings increased. Her financial situation and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and nails, among other materials.

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en:
Jeanny is married with three children. She is 42 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin.

To earn a living, Jeanny has a tricycle business and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 1,600. Jeanny has been a member of PMPC for five years.

In the future, Jeanny hopes to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for tricycle cab repair.

loans.name: Darwin Alfonso

texts.es: Darwin de 39 años de edad  vive con su esposo en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maíz y sorgo y cuando ha pasado la cosecha se dedica a vender pan dulce en las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su vivienda,  con las ventas que realiza de sus granos basicos y con el pago de su trabajo logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, el solicita un crédito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas y foliares, y poder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su esposa.
texts.en: Darwin is 39-year-old who lives with his wife in their own home, engaging in agriculture for several years by planting corn and sorghum and, when ithe harvest ends, he dedicates himself to selling sweet bread in the different areas that are close to his home. With sale of these grains and the payments from his work, he manages to cover the cost of your home. He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and foliates, and continue with his crops in order to gain moreand have a better life with his wife.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and foliates

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard es soltero y vive en casa de su madre en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como transporista público por mas de 10 horas al día.

Richard requiere el crédito para la reparación de su vehículo, pues el motor tiene un ruido y se apaga varias veces durante el día. También hará un mantenimiento general del vehículo, ya que él mantiene su casa y necesita trabajar sin perder ni un día de trabajo.

El sueño de Richard es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para poder empezar una profesión.
texts.en:
Richard is single and lives with his mother in the Villa Nueva Potosi area of La Paz. He works in public transportation and works more than 10 hours a day. 

Richard needs a loan in order to repair his vehicle. The motor makes a strange noise and turns off various times a day. He will also invest in the general maintenance of his vehicle, because he supports his household and needs to work without missing even a day of work. 

Richard's dream is to make enough money to embark on a profession.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his passenger vehicle.

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en:
Yeang, a 57 year-old mother of five children, is a local rice farmer on two hectares in Kampong Cham Province’s Prey Chhor district, where her residential area is. This is the only business that she owns and she has been with it for 35 years. 

Yeang has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s parnter) for the past four cycles and her previous loans, which she has fully repaid, have supported her business promptly and returned her a decent income with which to upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she is applying for a new loan in order to purchase rice seed, potash, and insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. She sincerely hopes to increase her income, which would improve her business and her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, potash, and insecticide, and to pay for labor costs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn is a 30-year-old mother of one dependent child from Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district. To support her family, she has cultivated rice on two hectares (nearly five acres) for 12 years. The business returns about 20,000 KHR, and she can save 10,000 KHR after deducting daily expenses. As the leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy the fertilizer and pesticides used to grow her cash-crop. She hopes to make more income from her business so that she can improve her living conditions.

Group member Yan has never borrowed from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, so this is her first loan. The total loan amount requested by the entire group is 2,500,000 KHR.

loans.use: To buy the fertilizer and pesticides used to grow her cash-crop.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Yoeung's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Yoeung is 26 years old and married. She has three children who are still in school.

To support the entire household, she and her husband have grown rice as the main source of income for several years. The current business has returned her about 26,400 KHR per day and she is able to save 8,600 KHR each day after offsetting the daily expenses.

Yoeung has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for the past three loan cycles. She has fully repaid her past loan which has uplifted her lifestyle into a good condition.

Now, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. She is requesting 1,400,000 KHR and more for two of her group members who are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland to grow rice. She hopes that she can get a high yield from her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to plow her farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Ela

texts.es: Ela, de 31 años de edad ,está casada y tiene un hijo,con quienes vive en su casa propia.Ela se dedica al alquiler de mototaxi. Tiene 2 vehículos que pudo comprar con los ahorros que iba juntando de otras actividades eventuales. Un mototaxi es conducido por su hijo mientras que el otro lo alquila a un chofer que diariamente llega a su vivienda para iniciar su labor. Al final del día recibe el pago establecido por la jornada de trabajo. Lleva trabajando en este negocio un promedio de 5 años y lo hace sola ya que su esposo se dedica a otras actividades. Comparte esta función con la venta ocasional de productos comestibles.Su trabajo le permite realizar otras funciones en el día y a la hora que ella lo considere necesario, comenta que no fue fácil emprender este trabajo ya que las dudas y los temores le embargaban porque no conocía sobre el funcionamiento de los vehículos y además no encontraba algún chofer confiable, pero poco a poco fue tomando empeño y ahora desarrolla su trabajo con mucha tranquilidad. Espera seguir alquilando sus vehículos para aumentar su flota.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado pondra en mantenimiento el motor de un mototaxi que se encuentra en mal estado.
texts.en:
Ela is 31 years old, married and has one child. She lives with them in their own house. She works renting a motorcycle taxi. Ela has 2 vehicles that she was able to buy by saving money from other activities. One motorcycle taxi is driven by her son and the other she rents to a driver that comes to her house every day to start work. 

At the end of the day she receives a pre-determined amount for each day of work. She has been doing this work for about 5 years and has only been doing it since her husband works in another field. She also occasionally sells food products. Her business allows her to do other things during the day and whenever she deems it necessary. Ela says it was not easy to launch her business because her doubts and fears prevented her and because she didn't know how vehicles worked and couldn't find a reliable driver. Little by little she took on the challenge and now she runs her business peacefully. 

Ela hopes to continue renting her vehicles and expand her fleet. She is requesting a loan and feels very grateful for the financial support she will receive in order to keep going. With the loan she will be able to maintain one of her motorcycle taxis that is in bad shape.

loans.use: to maintain her mototaxi.

loans.name: Ana Yudy

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su hija que tiene 12 años de edad. Ella se dedica  a la venta de lociones y cosméticos; el oficio lo inicio hace 6 años y lo realiza de lunes a sábado, hasta el momento no ha tenido ningún dificultad con el negocio.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar lociones, cremas, esmaltes, talcos, entre otros cosméticos para brindarles variedad de productos a los clientes; este le ayudara a incrementar el inventario y para su vida cotidiana.
Su sueño es que su hija continúe estudiando y culmine una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her 12 year old daughter. She works selling lotions and cosmetics. And began this work 6 years ago and she works Monday to Saturday. Until now she hasn't had any problems with her work. 

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy lotions, creams, nail polishes, powders and other cosmetics in order to offer a wider variety of products to her customers. It will help her increase her inventory. Her dream is for her daughter to continue studying and eventually go to university.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, nail polish, powders and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 28 years old and lives in Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with no children. 

 Analyn is engaged in a coconut buying and selling business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) and for resale.

Analyn has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts for copra and for resale.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is married with three children. She is 55 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban.

Lea sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Lea has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline lives in the Litein area of Kenya, where Mt. Kenya University is situated. She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 11 years.  Her primary income sources are eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Poultry farming'.  Her biggest challenge is 'Crop diseases.' Animals on the farm have not been given names.

Jackline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'They offer a reasonable grace period.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: 'They are good for the improvement of farmers.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit this family,' Jackline replied 'it will Improve their livelihood.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jackline owns the following: 'poultry' but does not own 'cow, pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, and automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net and sewing machine' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, TV or DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is a 41-year old mother of four. Her family lives in a rural village of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. To assist her husband in earning a living and supporting the education of their children, Liza is engaged in a hog-raising business. Usually, she generates PHP 1,500 for every hog that she raises. To further improve her business, Liza wants to request a PHP 18,000 loan, which she hopes will pave way for her business to grow. If the loan is granted, she will use it to buy livestock feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She is very positive that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el sorgo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa de sus padres con sus hermanos los cuales le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura, cuando pasa la temporada agrícola el cliente se dedica a trabajar de mecánico en un taller que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
This client has been working in agriculture for the last 5 years. This has given him the skills and knowledge he needs to look after his crops. He sows mainly maize and sorghum. He sells his crops to agencies in his locality that trade in staple grains. The money he makes from these sales helps pay some of his family’s bills. 

He lives in his parents’ home with his brothers and sisters; they help him with the farm work. When the agricultural season is over, this client works as a mechanic in a workshop close to where he lives. 

He is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure, seeds, fertilisers, and so on, which he uses to sow his crops. In this way he hopes to increase his earnings and so be able to continue contributing towards the household bills without difficulty.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilisers, etc.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 50 years old and lives in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is married with 4 children. Valentina has had a grocery store business for 15 years. She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil, sacks of sugar, shampoo, and assorted biscuits and candies. In the future, Valentina hopes to save for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sacks of sugar, shampoo, and assorted biscuits and candies

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun is 34 years old and engaged in rice farming, the area where she is gaining her daily net income. She has been operating in this occupation for over 10 years now and it has been very helpful in supporting her family's daily needs. Her husband and two children always give her a helping hand in maintaining the business.

Kun wants to have a clean kitchen to preserve personal hygiene for the household. For this reason, Kun is requesting additional capital amounting to 500,000 KHR to purchase building materials to build a kitchen. She believes that she will be able to serve healthy food to her family’s members through the loan help.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: Adeebajan

texts.en:
Adeebajan is a 43-year-old hardworking woman. Her husband is a laborer by profession and he has a very low monthly income. She has 5 children who are currently studying in government schools.

Adeebajan has some enterprising skills and she is running a small business in her house. She has been selling crockery and household utensils for 5 years. Her business is increasing with the passage of time.

Currently she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She would purchase new crockery items and utensils so that her sales would be increased. With the profit amount, Adeebajan would pay the tuition fees for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and is very hopeful for her children's bright future.

loans.use: to purchase crockery

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly, de 30 años de edad , es madre soltera de dos pequeños hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres.El trabajo de Kelly consiste en la venta de platillos típicos de la región. Todos los días al llegar la noche instala en la vereda de su casa los implementos necesarios como cocina, mesas y sillas con los cuales atiende amablemente a sus clientes. Su labor empieza desde muy temprano con la compra de los ingredientes necesarios como carnes frescas, verduras, arroz, pescados y otros. Trabaja con ayuda de su madre desde hace 1 año y por fortuna su actividad marcha de maravilla.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener el tiempo necesario durante el día para dedicárselos a sus hijos y apoyarlos en sus actividades escolares, del mismo modo también le agrada los ingresos económicos que diariamente percibe como ganancias por sus ventas, su gran meta es establecer un restaurante en una parte del terreno de su casa y continuar su camino al éxito.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 300, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, condimentos, carnes, aceite y otros ingredientes que usa continuamente en la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Kelly is 30 years old and the single mother of two children. She lives with them at her parents' house. Kelly's work is selling typical dishes from the region. Every day when night falls, she sets up, outside her house, the necessary elements to serve her customers: tables, chairs and a kitchen. Her work begins early, with the purchase of necessary ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, fish and more. Her mother has been helping her for a year and fortunately everything is going really well. 

What Kelly likes about her work is that it allows her to have enough time during the day to spend with her children and help them with their schoolwork. She also likes her income and seeing her daily sales gains. Her goal is to start a restaurant on her family's land and continue her path to success. She is very happy to have financial support because that's how she will advance in her business. She is dedicated to paying back her loan on time. With the loan she will buy rice, condiments, meat, oil and other ingredients that she uses everyday to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, meat and condiments.

loans.name: Nha

texts.en:
A 45-year-old mother of seven children from Bovel district of Battambang province, Nha is a corn grower on a three-hectare area. To supplement the family income, her husband is a house builder. 

She has been involved in the current business for three years, earning about 34,000 KHR per day. This is the first time for Nha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to plow her farmland and to buy corn seed and potash for her farmland. 

She highly hopes that she can grow her corn timely and fruitfully, so that she can sustain her lifestyle and provide sufficient food for her children.

loans.use: to plow her farmland and to buy corn seed and potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Noeurm's Group

texts.en:
Noeurm, 59, is a citizen from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has two children. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice on two hectares. She has been involved in this business for 10 years, earning about 27,500 KHR per day and manages to save about 17,500 KHR each day.

Noeurm is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). After the successful past loan which she repaid completely, she feels confident that she can improve her living condition better than before.

Now she is a leader of a group consisting of two other members in order to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total amount for her group loan is 2,600,000 KHR, of which 800,000 KHR is her loan portion. As a leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, pesticides, and plow her farmland. She hopes to increase her income to expand more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, pesticides and plow her farmland

loans.name: Chanty

texts.en: Originally from Battambang province’s Phnom Proek district, Chanty is 25 years old and a married mother of two little kids. To address the family’s hardship, she is a local corn farmer, while her husband is a paid worker. With the current business she can earn about 20,500 KHR per day. Chanty has never used VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is applying for her first loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR to buy corn seeds and plow her farmland. She hopes to increase her income to improve living conditions for her family and to reserve for her kids’ education when they are old enough for schooling.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and plow her farmland

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 32 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel. She is married with two children. 

Janeth has a grocery store and has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan to purchase gallons of cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce, bags of sugar and salt, assorted biscuits and candies.

Janeth has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, she hopes to have enough money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce, bags of sugar and salt, assorted biscuits and candies.

loans.name: Samina Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 28-year-old diligent woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and 5 children. In the picture, Samina is raising her hand. Her husband has been running a school canteen for five years. 

Samina, as a member of a three person group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would use it to purchase food supplies because the canteen's current stock is almost finished. He would also do some repair work required for the canteen. This loan is very important for his business, and Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase food for a canteen and make repairs

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
A 56-year-old mother of five children, Sou is a farmer from Pursat Province. She is a village chief, and also manages a rice farm and pig-raising business for extra income. She has been with this business since she was 22 years old and it is currently generating 22,700 KHR per day for her. Sou's previous loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was her first and she has fully repaid it. Thanks to the first loan, her living condition is better than before. 

Now, she is applying for a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR in order to pay to plow her farmland. She hopes that she can grow her rice on time and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay to plow her farmland

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a 39-year-old man. He lives with his family in Punjab, Pakistan, and is the father of 3 daughters and son. 

Since 2002, he has been running a general store, which is the only source of income for his family. He works very hard to meet his family's needs. Amin needs additional capital to grow his business and he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase wheat, flour, rice, pulses, detergent, soap, etc. This will help him to satisfy his clients and save for his children's future.

Amin is very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for his family. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell at his general store.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Living in Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Pen is 56 years old and a father of eight children, two of whom are still in school and under his dependency. To feed his entire family, he grows rice and corn as the main source of income for twelve. 

This the first time for Pen to have a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is seeking 2,000,000 KHR to buy seed and to pay for the plowing fee for his farmland. 

He hopes that he can earn income to send his kids to school and to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seed and to pay for the plowing fee for his farmland.

loans.name: Alejo Jose

texts.en:
Alejo, age 58, lives in Guayaquil.  Fifteen years ago he started his profession as a bricklayer.  Little by little he was getting known by his customers of the jobs that he did like building houses.

He currently continues with his business because he supports his household.  He has four children, and one of them is 15 years old.  That is why he wants the loan in order to buy him school supplies (his son appears in the photo).  He does not have enough with his income to buy them.

In the future he wants to improve his home and his son’s education.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 38-year-old responsible mother of three children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and children. Her husband is janitor in a hospital, but his salary is not enough to meet the household expenses. He wants to start his own work. 

Saima has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase a rickshaw from the loan amount, and he would drive the rickshaw at night along with his present job. In this way, his monthly income would be increased, and they would be able to send their children to school.

Saima is very hopeful for this loan, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw.

loans.name: Andrena

texts.en:
Andrena is married with four children. She is 30 years old and lives in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Andrena sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

Andrena has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings for additional capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sugar and baking powder, gallons of cooking oil, and cans of milk.

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 37-year-old, hardworking housewife with four sons and three daughters, and is a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the past five years, her husband has been driving a van, which is the only source of income for his family. 

Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her husband's transportation business by buying a new van. They are saving money for this purpose, and with the addition of the loan amount, they would be able to buy this van. 

This will not only help expand their transportation business, but will also help increase their monthly income. Shaheen is very hopeful that the loan will be productive so that they can meet the basic necessities of their family and provide education to their children.

loans.use: to purchase a van.

loans.name: Sonia Esmeralda

texts.es: Sonia  vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, sonia es una mujer dedicada a su labor, luchadora siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herbicidas, herramienta, etc. y también para mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía que es donde siembra sus cultivos.  Sonia  está segura que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Sonia lives with her life partner and her 1 year old son. She works as a farmer. Specifically, she grows corn and sorghum. She has been working in this role for many years and she has gained very valuable experience that enables her to get the best harvests. She sells in all the surrounding areas and has many stable customers. These people always prefer her produce because it is high quality and the prices are really affordable. Also, the service is unmatched. Sonia is a woman who is very dedicated to her work and a fighter who is always ready to work hard to achieve success. She needs to invest in supplies but needs capital and so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will enable her to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc, and also to improve the land that is shown in the photo which is where she grows her crops. Sonia is sure that she will be able to pay off her debts and, at the same time, she is confident that she will be able to give her family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Thouk's Group

texts.en:
Thouk is 26 years old and married. She has four dependent children who are still in school. The rest of her family is residing in Kampong Cham province, where cassava is the well known crop in the local area. Not different from her neighborhood, she also grows cassava as the main source of income on a two-hectare area, and does rice cultivation on one hectare to supplement her income. She is able to earn up to 19,400 KHR per day from the current business, which she has had for several years. 

This is the third loan for Thouk with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her past loans, which enabled her to support her cassava business in a timely manner. For this cycle, she joins a group consisting of two borrowers. 

As the leader, Thouk will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide and to pay for the plowing fee. She highly hopes that she can maintain her living condition in good shape.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and to pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is widow with four children. Lorna is 56 years old and lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Lorna sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 12 years. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 12  years. In the future, Lorna hopes to have more savings for additional capital.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 45 years old. She is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Maribel provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. She has had her business for more than one year, and earns about PHP 300 daily. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000; she will use it to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle. 

She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phoeurn's Group

texts.en: Phoeurn, a resident from Kampong Cham province, is 43 years old and married. She has two dependent children, one schoolchild and one little kid. For her, one and one half hectares to grow rice and one hectare to grow cassava are her main sources of income. For the 23 years that she has been with her business, she has been able to earn up to 14,400 KHR per day. This is the third time for Phoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan with success to upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she is in a group of four to apply for a new loan. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each while her other co-borrowers are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. For Phoeurn as the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is a kind and smart woman. She is married. She always wanted to live in good living conditions, but her husband does not have a big source of income. Her husband has been busy with selling dried fruits.  

Gulchehra is able to sew curtains and national blankets. She plans to organize her own business with sewing. She studied at the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ of the women's organization and gained enough skills about business. 

She will manage the business alone. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married with two children. Margarita is 60 years old and lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Margarita sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 35 years. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

Margarita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Margarita hopes to have more savings for additional capital in her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: Cool Girls Group

texts.en:
Marilyn is the featured borrower of the Cool Girls' Group. She got together with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends since they came to Lebanon to work hard for their family's living.

Marilyn is the one in the middle. She is a 49-year-old divorced woman and mother of three children that she takes care of. She works hard to send them money to cover their living and education expenses. She works as a housekeeper and she misses her family a lot. Marilyn is looking forward to the day she can unite with her family forever. The loan will be sent to her children back in the Philippines to cover their education expenses.

Josephine is the one on the right. She is a 49-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She works as a housekeeper to provide her children with the best education ever.

Judyirene is a 51-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She works as a housekeeper in order to send money to her family in the Philippines for living and education needs. Her requested loan will be invested for the same purpose as additional help.

loans.use: To cover her children's education expenses

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married with 2 children; she is 50 years old and lives in Agunod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Lucia has a piggery business. She has had this business for seven years, and has been a member of PMPC for six years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 6,000.00. 

Lucia hopes to save for her family's future.

loans.use: to pay for additional piglets.

loans.name: Florepe

texts.en:
Florepe is married with five children. She is 39 years old and lives in Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Florepe sells longaniza and dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns  6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this work. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase longaniza and dried fish.

Florepe has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Florepe hopes to have enough money saved to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchased longaniza and dried fish.

location.town: Plaridel-Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 53 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with nine children. 

Manuela catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials. Manuela has been a member of PMPC for two years. She hopes to save enough money for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: 01.05.09 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. An operates a food stall/restaurant selling tofu. She is requesting a loan to purchase beans to make tofu.

An is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 01.05.09 Đông Sơn solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. This is An's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

An has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, An hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase beans to make tofu.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat is married and has two children who are non-adults. She always wanted to provide them with a good education, and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Farogat decided to start a new business by teaching pupils in her house and getting money for each lesson. She works at the school as a teacher of Russian and has a small salary. She studied at the course called "To Get Ahead" in a women's organization and got enough skills about business. 

She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy a desk, a chair and a blackboard for organizing a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a desk, chair and blackboard for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Ruben De Jesus

texts.es:
Rubén, vive con su familia, está casado y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad. El se dedica a la venta de ropa, el oficio lo inicio hace un año y lo realiza de lunes a sábado, tenía experiencia de años anteriores en el negocio.
El préstamo que requiere optar le permitirá comprar variedad de ropa tales como: pantalones, chores, blusas, faldas, vestidos, entre otros; este le ayudara a mejorar en el negocio para tener variedad de estilos de ropa para ofrecerle a los clientes y que estos se sientan satisfechos con la mercadería.
Su sueño es seguir incrementando el inventario y así ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Ruben lives with his family. He is married and has a son, who is 4 years old. He started selling clothing a year ago and works from Mondays to Saturdays. He had prior experience in the business.

The loan he has chosen to obtain will enable him to purchase a variety of clothes, such as pants, shorts, blouses, skirts and dresses among other items. This will help him to improve his business through having a variety of clothing styles to offer customers so they will feel satisfied with the merchandise.

His dream is to continue increasing inventory and expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shorts, blouses, skirts and dresses among other items.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk, aged 30, lives in a district of Kompong Cham with his wife and child. He and his wife have struggled a lot to earn money working in local garment factories in the province and provide better living conditions to their small child. To make an extra income, the couple has tried to work overtime until late evening and have sometimes left their child behind with their relatives. They are working in different places, and Uk had to bring his wife to work on his motorbike and pick her up every day. His wife had to pay for a ride occasionally when the motorbike was not available. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for his wife to commute to her workplace. This motorcycle would help them save more time for other activities at home and not have to hurry to their workplaces. The challenge for them is that the fuel here is expensive, so they must save some money for gasoline costs. He is thankful for the support that HKL and Kiva lenders have provided him to address his living difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his wife's commute to her workplace.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en: Madalena is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles and rice. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $200. Madalena is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles and rice to sell

loans.name: Sakar

texts.en:
Sakar is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 23 years old and is a father of a single child. 

Sakar is a grocer. He owns a small grocery store, where he offers to sell all the needs of a family like dairy products, juices, drinks, snacks, canned foods and detergents. He has been in this field since 2005 and has gained good experience. Thanks to his great customer service, Sakar has achieved fame and respect in the neighborhood.

Sakar is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 USD to pay the annual rent of his grocery store. Sakar is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his child a good education and a bright future.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his grocery store.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has four children and has been doing this work for 14 years. Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "sheep." Her biggest challenge is animal diseases, she says. Animals on the farm have been given no names. 

Regina was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "It has friendly rates." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Juhudi Kilimo is the best as it is there to buy a dairy cow."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Regina replied, "It will help me generate income to pay school fees for my children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Regina owns the following: a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and running water, but does not have electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, a TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria de 41 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Ella  se dedica al cultivo de maiz, sorgo . De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. Es una mujer  muy trabajadora, honrada  y responsable. Siempre está al pendiente de su familia ya que para ella es su principal fuente de inspiración y desea poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito  para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
María, who is 41 years old, lives with her husband and their five children in a house they own. She cultivates corn and sorghum in order to make a living and put bread on the table everyday. She farms year after year and this is the only way she knows to make a living.

She is a very hardworking, honest and responsible woman. She always watches out for her family members since they are the principal source of inspiration for her and she wants to be able to improve their standard of living.

She has decided to apply for a loan in order to buy her main farming supplies, such as fertilizer, pest poisons, seeds, etc. She hopes to make a good profit because she has no other source of income. She trusts in God that she will have a bountiful harvest, which will enable her to continue feeding her family everyday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pest poison, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta is married with three children. She is 57 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Alberta is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides. Alberta has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Alberta hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married with five children. Lourdes is 60 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She sells variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.
Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Lourdes hopes to have more savings for additional capital.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, and cans of milk

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is 43 years old and lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Conchita sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fish. Conchita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Conchita hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fish

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and seeds as well as to pay for labor and some spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Adriana Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Adriana, de oficio comerciantes es una de las mejores clientes de MICREDITO, trabajadora muy activa, con muchos deseo de superarse y sacar su negocio adelante. Está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le ha brindado atravez del financiamiento Kiva que se le otorga cuando más lo necesita. Siempre sigue vendiendo comida ahora quiere agregar la venta de frutas y jugos y seguir vendiendo más platillos. Ahora requiere el crédito para comprar piña, papaya, sandias, mangos, naranjas, azúcar, aceite carne etc. Poco a poco desea ir logrando alcanzar su meta de tener su Kiosco de comida.
texts.en:
Doña Adriana, a merchant by trade, is one of MICREDITO’s best clients. She is a very active, hardworking woman who is eager to succeed and move her business forward.  She is very grateful for the support provided to her through Kiva funding since it was available to her just when she needed it most. 

She continues to sell cooked food but now she wants to add fruit and juice sales along with her meals. She requires a loan now in order to purchase pineapple, papaya, watermelon, mangos, oranges, sugar, oil, meat, etc. 

She wants to continue striving to reach her goal of having a food kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase pineapple, papaya, watermelon, mangos, oranges, sugar, oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 56 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.  Luz catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials. Luz has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Luz hopes to have enough money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 28-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and children. She has been selling buffalo milk for eight years. All the people in her area purchase milk from her. Currently, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. As the demand of milk is increasing day by day, she wants to buy one more buffalo to meet the increasing demand of her customers. With the increase in milk production, her savings and monthly income would be increased. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Isatu from Tombo western rural area. She is married with seven children and three of her children are going to school. She started her business to earn her daily meal.

Isatu sells local food such as boiled cassava and cake. She has been running this business since 2008.  She works at the business every day and ten hours per day within her environment.    She says that the main challenge is a lack of finance to run her business.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to change her business to a food stand business selling onions, sugar and cooking oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her income and pay her children's school. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a higher level. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to change her business to a food stand business selling products such as onions, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is 42 years-old and happily married to Pedro who works as an engineer. God blessed them with loving children. She and her husband are helping each other working so they can give their family a good future.

Jocelyn owns a computer shop. These computer shops are rented for Php20.00 per hour. Some families don’t have their own computers so they go to computer shops to encode and print documents. Others rent to connect with their loved ones abroad and others, especially the children and the youth, rent to play games. Normally, computer shops open at 8am and close at 7pm. Her regular customers are the children and youth of their community. She earns Php 4000.00 a month.

Just as other business owners, she is also hoping that her shop will continue to expand and have more customers and branches. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is married with six children. She is 54 years-old and lives in San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Esmeralda operates her store in order to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns 3000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan in order to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and canned goods.

Esmeralda has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for three years. In the future, Esmeralda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and canned goods.

location.town: Liloy-San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: 03.08.07- Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hướng works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase baby livestock and cattle to raise and sell in  the future.

Hướng is 45 years-old and she is married with two children.

Hướng is the group leader of the 03.08.07 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members.  One of her children is grown up so Hướng lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hướng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in order to improve her  business. Hướng has successfully repaid two loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hướng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main harship that Hướng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hướng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock and cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Sreynouch's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ou Reang Ov district where farming is a common way to make a living, Sreynouch is a 29-year-old mother of three dependent children who are still in school. Rice farming and cassava growing are the main source of the family’s income and she and her husband have been doing this for several years. They can earn about 25,000KHR per day to support the family’s needs.

Sreynouch has joined Kiva’s partner VisionFund and nowshe is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to purchase fertilizer for her cultivated land and a portion to spend on labor.  Sreynouch hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income so as to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her cultivated land.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para invertir en esta temporada;  este le permitirá comprar variedad de frutas y verduras tales como: manzanas, uvas, naranjas, sandias, tomates, cebollas, chiles, etc. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a satisfacer la necesidad de los clientes y la demanda que se presentaba; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Cristino is in need of a new loan because he needs more working capital to invest during this season.  This will allow him to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables such as apples, grapes, oranges,watermelon, tomatoes, onions, chiles, etc.  His previous loan helped him to meet the needs of his customers and the demand that they presented him.  His financial and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: buy apples, grapes, oranges,watermelon, tomatoes, onions, chiles, etc.

loans.name: 01.07.02 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lân is 50 years old and married with three children, two of which are grown.  The other child is still dependent upon her, and they live in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. 

Lân is the group leader of the 01.07.02 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members.  She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodles for five years; she is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make the rice noodles.  

One of the most critical business difficulties she has is the lack of capital.

In 2010, Lân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lân hopes her family will be healthy and happy, that her children will find good jobs, and that her business will do well.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make rice noodles.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 40 years old, a widow, and has three children; two are school age and one an infant age. They are residing at Sabang, Larena, Siquijor.

She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month to cover her living expenses. Now, she is requesting a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and canned goods.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business with the help of this institution.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia, de 54 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos con quienes vive en su propia casa.La actividad que realiza Amelia es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de distintos sabores y marcas ya que cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con sus ahorros y la instaló en su casa, desde allí  los atiende de manera amable y cordial ya que sabe que con ese trato se ganará la preferencia de sus clientes. Hasta el momento trabaja sola y le va muy bien. Lleva 30 años realizando esta labor. Complementa su trabajo con la venta de comida.Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y por el consumo constante de bebidas gasificadas.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de bebidad gasificadas de diversas marcas y tamaños.
texts.en:
Amelia is 54 years old and is a single mother of 4 children.  She lives with them in her own house.  Amelia works selling carbonated drinks of various flavors and brands, which was made possible when she bought a refrigerator with her savings and set it up in her house.  From there, she serves her customers in a friendly and cordial manner, since she knows that by doing so she will gain their loyalty.

She works alone and it has been going well for her.  She has been doing this for 30 years.  In addition to selling drinks, she also sells food.  She considers her business very worthwhile due to the profits it brings her and the constant consumption of carbonated drinks.

At this time, she asks for 1,000 sols (US$400).  She is very glad knowing that she will have financial support, since she will feel more secure that she can advance her business.  She will invest the money that she's asking for to buy carbonated drinks of various brands and sizes.

loans.use: buy carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oranges, chilies, kale, and flasks to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is married with four children. She is 44 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Ofelia sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

Ofelia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Ofelia hopes to have more savings for capital.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: 03.08.08 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngân operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Ngân is 53 years old, and she is married with two children. Ngân is the group leader of the 03.08.08 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members. One of her chldren is grown up, so Ngân lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ngân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Ngân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Ngân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mayeteh

texts.en:
Mayeteh is in her late thirties years old and married with three children. Two of her children are currently attending school. She runs a soap business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since 2011, and sells soap and soap powder.  She says that the main challenge to her business is a poor business location.

Mayeteh requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy general stock, including soap and soap powder.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her status of living, and pay her installment. 

In the future, she would like to sell gallons of palm oil. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy general stock including soap and soap powder.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has three children. Fares along with his wife provide the family income.

Fares is a photographer. He specializes in filming weddings and parties. He has been practicing this business since 1990 and has gained good experience in this field. Now Fares has 2 employees hired already and since he in the only professional photographer in the area, he gained an excellent reputation in the surroundings.

Fares is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. Fares is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that someday he may be in a bigger workplace to increase his productions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop.

loans.name: 04-04-12-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Căn has a service business repairing bicycles and motorbikes. She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain the motorbike repair shop.

Căn is 64 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 04-04-12-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. Her children are grown up so Căn lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Căn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Căn has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Căn has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Căn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain the motorbike repair shop.

loans.name: Llensy

texts.es: Llensy, de 20 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres en donde comparten sus alegrías y tristezas luchando siempre por salir adelante.El trabajo de Llensy consiste en la crianza de animales de corral como patos y gallinas. Posee una pequeña granja en donde esta criando más de 100 aves. Cuando alcanzan el peso ideal para el consumo realiza la venta de los animales en algún mercado de la ciudad o en su misma casa hasta donde llegan sus potenciales compradores. Por cada animal vendido le corresponde un ingreso económico considerable que le permite sobrellevar los gastos que diariamente se generan en su hogar. Lleva realizando esta labor desde hace 5 años. Trabaja sola.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le brinda independencia y facilidad de disponer de su horario, le esta yendo bien y espera seguir así, su meta principal es consolidar una granja grande en donde pueda albergar una mayor cantidad de aves así como también establecer un corral para la crianza de otos animales como cuyes y conejos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo.Con el monto solicitado comprará alimentos balanceados para sus animales de granja.
texts.en:
Llensy is 20 years old, married, and has a 2-year-old son.  She lives in her parents' house, where they share their happiness and sadness as they constantly are trying to get ahead.  Llensy's work involves raising penned animals such as ducks and chickens.  She has a small farm where she is raising more than 100 birds.  When they reach the desired weight for consumption, she sells the animals in a market in the city or in her house, where potential customers come.

Each animal that she sells earns her a considerable profit, which allows her to take care of the daily household expenses.  She has been doing this for 5 years and works by herself.  What she likes about this job is that it gives her independence and the ability to make her own schedule.  It is going well for her and she hopes that it continues to do so.

Her main goal is to establish a large farm where she can keep a larger number of birds.  In addition, she wants to set up a pen where she can raise other animals such as guinea pigs and rabbits.  

At this time, she is asking for 500 sols (US$200).  She is very grateful for this financial support that is being offered, for it lets her get ahead with her work.  With the money that she is asking for, she will buy wholesome feed for her farm animals.

loans.use: buy wholesome feed for her farm animals.

loans.name: 03.01.81-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Phượng operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. Phượng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Phượng is 53 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 03.01.81 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

In 2011, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phượng has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 60 years old, married with 12 children, all are in adult ages and they all reside at Canal, Siquijor, Siquijor.

She's been in business for three years and earns P 15,000.00 a month to support thier daily needs. She had requested a loan amouting to P 35,000.00 to purchase fuel for her retail business.

She's been a PMPC member for almost three years and aims to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for her retail business.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, está casado y tiene tres hijos, los cuales tiene edades de 4, 8 y 12, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El  se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 25 años, lo aprendió de sus padres y lo lleva a cabo todos los días de 6:00am  a 3:00pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas para llevar a cabo el cultivo; este le ayudara a adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios.
Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y continuar trabajando la tierra.
texts.en:
Victor is married and has 3 children (ages 4, 8, and 12).  She doesn't have any family outside of where she lives.  He works growing basic grains such as corn and beans.  He's been doing this for 25 years and learned it from his parents.  He works every day from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm.

The loan that he needs will allow him to buy manure, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and fungicide.  This will help him with his farming and help him gain the profits that he needs.

His dream is to pay for his children's schooling and continue working the land.

loans.use: buy manure, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and fungicide.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra,  solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para surtir más el  negocio de venta de sandalias y ropa; este le permitirá comprar, sandalias, variedad de ropa para ambos sexo y edades tales como: blusas, camisas, pantalones, chores, faldas, vestidos, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a tener variedad de mercadería para los clientes y así satisfacer las necesidades de ellos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Sandra is applying for a new loan due to the need for more working capital so she can continue to stock her business selling sandals and clothing. This loan will allow her to buy sandals and a variety of clothes for both sexes and different ages, such as blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, skirts and dresses, among other items.

Her previous loan helped her to have a variety of merchandise for her customers and thus satisfy their needs. Her economic situation and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to purchase sandals, blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, skirts and dresses among other items.

loans.name: Ulziijargal

texts.en:
Mr. Ulziijargal, 55 years old, lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. His remaining children all got married and live separately from their parents. He has been working as a watchman at a private business entity for three years. Before this job in 2000, he started rendering taxi services to the local people and accumulated vast amounts of experience in picking up customers, driving them quickly to their destination and shortening roads. His wife has a disability and gets disability pension from the state. His elder son transports goods between districts. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials he can repair and insulate his old wooden house. As a result, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Efrain Enrique

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Efrain en su negocio de venta de mercancía variada, como ropa femenina e informal y bolsos, ahora vende mucho más pues su clientela se incrementó. Su meta es lograr ofrecer una gran variedad de artículos de todos los que sus clientes desean, necesitan o requieren. Efraín se encuentra muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado y pide que sigan apoyando a los microempresarios como el. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva el cual invertirá en la remodelación del local, con ello mejorará la imagen y los clientes están mejor ubicados para llegar a su negocio, convirtiendo así el credikiva en una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Efraín is thankful to those who support his business, where he sells various items such as women's clothing, casual clothing, and bags.  He now sells a lot more because he has gained many more customers.  His goal is to be able to offer a large variety of all kinds of items that his customers want, need, or require. 

Efraín is very grateful for the support that he has received and asks that they continue to support small businesses such as his.  He is now asking for a new Kiva loan which he will use to invest in remodeling his shop.  In this way, he will improve his image and his customers will be in an area where they can access his business more easily.  His Kiva loan will become a successful investment.

loans.use: invest in buying construction materials to remodel his shop.

loans.name: Ludima
