texts.en: Ludima, a 50-year-old married mother of seven, lives in Calaca-an, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental where, to earn a living, she has run a hog-raising business for five years, each month earning approximately PHP 2,000.00.  A member of PMPC for nine years. Ludima is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of feeds. She hopes to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feeds

loans.name: 04-07-13-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thường operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Thường is 50 years old and she is married with two children. Thường is the group leader of the 04-07-13-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent; another is grown up.

This is Thường first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thường has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Thường faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thường hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Ilario

texts.es:
Ilario, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar semilla, abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, pago de mozo  y preparar el terreno.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a cultivar granos básicos tales como: maíz, maicillo, frijol y con ello una excelente cosecha; las condiciones económicas han mejorado, el grupo familiar se mantiene el mismo.
texts.en:
Ilario is requesting a new loan due to his need for more capital to invest in the cultivation of staple foods.  This will enable him to purchase seeds, compost, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides as well as to prepare the land and pay for a young worker.

The previous loan helped him cultivate basic grains, such as corn, sorghum, and beans, and thereby have an excellent harvest.   The economic conditions have improved and his family remains the same.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides, as well as to pay both for help and for preparing his fields.

loans.name: Solidario Abejitas De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Solidario Abejitas de Santo Tomas
este grupo está conformado por doña Ana Lucrecia de 38 años de edad y tiene tres hijos todos pequeños y estudian en la escuelita de Santo Tomas, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, pantalones para dama, caballero y niño, en santo tomas ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su negocio en su venta de ropa su idea es seguir invirtiendo y seguir creciendo su negocio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa en diferentes diseños.
texts.en: One of the members of the Solidario Abejitas de Santo Tomas group is Doña Ana Lucrecia, who is 38 years old. She has three children, all of whom are small and going to school in Santo Tomas. She sells clothing, shoes and pants for women, men and children. She is applying for a loan in Santo Tomas to invest in her clothing business. Her idea is to continue investing in and growing her business. She wants to buy clothing in different designs.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is marrried with three children. Susana is 58 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Susana is a farmer, together with her husband, and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP (Philippines pesos) to redeem pawned coconut land. 

Susana has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Susana hopes to have a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to redeem pawned coconut land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members: her mother. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

Rehema has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 10 years, selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include transport and seasonality. She is hoping to start importing used clothes and also to build rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Fatmata from Tombo, Western Rural Area, in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of 4 and 21 years old. Her children are not going to school because she can’t afford money to educate them.

In 2008, Fatmata established her juice and pure water business. She began her business to get a permanent source of income to support herself and her children. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of financial support to increase her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy soft drinks, juice and pure water for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate the male children and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juice and pure water for resale.

loans.name: 04-07-09-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thực operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell. Thực has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thực faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thực is 49 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents (her children are grown up).

 In 2011, Thực joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thực has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thực is the group leader of the 04-07-09-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members.

 With her business profit, Thực hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell.

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Suyapa es una mujer de 39 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completa y junto a su esposo y su numerosa familia compuesta por 9 hijos de los cuales 4 de ellos están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados de educación 2 entre edades de 14 y 16 años ayudan con las diferentes actividades en el campo y los últimos 3 en cuidado ya que son menores de edad. Ella y su familia se dedican al cultivo de papa desde hace mucho tiempo y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a cultivarla como también a comercializarla en el mercado local y sus alrededores. Ella también cultiva granos básicos a pequeña escala que al mismo tiempo son también comercializados una parte y la otra para el consumo de su familia. El terreno que ella y su esposo cultivan es propio gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio impuesto por muchos años de trabajo el cual está ubicado a 20 metros de su casa de habitación por lo cual les permite mantener cuidado y sano sus cultivos.

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y foliares para dar una mejor y mayor asistencia a sus cultivos ya que por medio de esto ella podrá aprovechar su cosecha al máximo.

Sus metas a corto plazo son de poder aumentar sus cosechas para producir más y generar más ingresos para cubrir los gastos de estudio, alimentación, vestimenta, medicina para el bienestar de sus hijos. Su sueño es seguir apoyando a sus hijos en la parte educativa para que ellos puedan graduarse y estudiar una carrera universitaria de provecho en el futuro.
texts.en:
Doña Suyapa is a determined 39 year old woman with a primary school education. She lives with her husband and her large family composed of nine children, four of whom are attending different grades in school in the community. Two of her children, who are 14 and 16 years old, help with different tasks in the fields and the last three are being cared for at home because they are still very young.

She and her family have cultivated potatoes for a long time. Her parents taught her how to cultivate them and also how to sell them at the local market and in surrounding areas. She also cultivates basic grains on a small scale, part of which she sells at the same time, while she keeps the other part for family consumption. The land that she and her husband cultivate is their own, thanks to their many years of work and sacrifice. It is located 20 meters from their home, which enables them to keep their crops well cared for and healthy. 

She is currently requesting help to purchase compost, fertilizer and foliar applications in order to provide more and better care for her crops. Thus she will be able to capitalize on the best harvest possible.

Her short term goals are to increase yields so that she can harvest more and generate more income in order to cover the costs of school, food, clothing and medicine for her children’s well being. Her dream is to continue supporting her children’s education so they can graduate and study for good careers at the university in the future.

loans.use: to purchase compost, foliar sprays and fertilizer for her crops and vegetables.

loans.name: 04-11-06-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Tuyết is 41 years old, and she is married with two children. Tuyết is the group leader of the 04-11-06-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2012, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyết has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Maa Maheswari-1 Group

texts.en:
Maa Maheswari-1, a joint liability group, was formed in the year 2010 by five active women of Bhawanipatna town of Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Kalahandi is known for drought and backwardness.

Indurani is one of the members of this group. She is standing on the extreme left with a raised hand in the photograph. She is a very energetic and hardworking lady. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 30 and 28, who have completed their studies and help their parents in household work. Presently, Indurani is residing in a small house with her family.

Indurani is running a pickle business. She makes the pickles herself and also procures ready-made pickles from the nearest market in Andhra Pradesh state and supplies the retailers of Bhawanipatna town. To help her in preparation of pickles, she has engaged two female workers. Her husband supplies the pickles to 20-30 retailers in the town. He also goes to the nearest markets to sell the pickles. Indurani earns a monthly income of 8,000 Indian rupees (INR) from her existing business. She says this income is not at all enough for her to manage the family and think for the future. So, she wants to increase the size her business to earn some extra income.

With the present loan, Indurani wants to procure ready-made pickles in bulk and also to get mangos, oil, spices, Accent, etc., for preparation in her house. This will help her to decrease the transportation and materials costs, as she brings it frequently. Indurani hopes to set up a pickle-making unit of her own with 5-6 workers.

The other four members of the group are Punya, Saraswati, Sebati and Bina who are running a tea stall, spice business, four wheeler repairing center and tiffin stall and cycle mart respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing ready-made pickles, mangos, oil, spices, etc.

loans.name: 04-06-03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. Phượng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Phượng is 53 years old and she is married with three children. Her children are grown up, so Phượng lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Phượng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 04-06-03-Nam Ngạn Solidarity Group, which consists of nine members.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to buy land of her own, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: 04-11-08-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngân operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable and resell.

Ngân is 57 years old and is married with one child. She is the group leader of the 04-11-08-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents as her child is grown up.

This is Ngân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main harship that Ngân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable to resell.

loans.name: 3.5.285.14.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết has a general store business. She is requesting a loan to purchase items to resell.

Tuyết is 53 years old and is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 3.5.285.14.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tuyết first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is a 29 yea-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband and 4 sons. Her husband's income is too low to cover their household expenses, so Faridah has been running a beauty salon to help her husband in generating income. She has excellent beautician skills. She has recently started this business and currently she has insufficient supplies for her business. She wants to purchase variety of products for her beauty salon. For that she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a blow dryer and cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, makeup kits, and eye shades.

Faridah dreams for the success of her business. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer and cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, makeup kits, and eye shades.

loans.name: Sokong's Group

texts.en:
Sokong is 27 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children in a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district, Cambodia. He is a farmer who grows rice and cassava--he has been in this business for seven years. The current business earns his family about 20,000KHR per day to feed the family but he manages to save about 8,000KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Sokong’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now he is leading his group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokong wants to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: 3.14.287.19.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cúc works in agriculture farming: poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

Cúc is 51 years old and is married with 4 children. She is the group leader of the 3.14.287.19.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
Her children are grown up, so Cúc supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Cúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Cúc has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Cúc hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar,  es una persona muy reconocida por ser honrado  y trabajador,  vive con su esposa  y un hijo de tres años de edad. El se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias tales como: maíz, maicillo y frijol, tiene que pagar mano de obra para realizar esta actividad, el oficio lo heredo de su padre  y lo lleva a cabo desde hace 8 años, la dificultad que posee es la distancia del lugar de trabajo.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar seis quintales de abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas para fertilizar una manzana de maíz sembrada; esta inversión le ayudara a que la cosecha se dé libre de plagas por los fertilizantes que se usara, incrementar los ingresos  económicas; el riesgo que puede ser  es un invierno muy copioso o con pocas lluvias que afectan la producción.
Su sueño es incrementar la cosecha, también las utilidades para tener una mayor  calidad de vida y un futuro mejor para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Oscar is well known for being honest and hardworking.  He lives with his wife and three-year-old child.

He makes a living in farming activities such as corn, sorghum, and beans.  He has to pay for labor to do this work.  He inherited this trade from his father and has done it for eight years.  The problem he has is the distance to where he works.

The loan he needs will allow him to buy six quintals of soil amendments, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide to fertilize one manzana of planted corn.

This investment will help his harvest be free of pests because of the fertilizer he'll use.  He'll also increase his income.  The risk is that it could be a plentiful winter or there could be little rain, which affects the crop.

His dream is to increase his harvest and his profits to have a better quality of life and a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: doña guadalupe de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 6 hijos quienes estudian actualmente, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, su principal siembra es el maiz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarla a las agencias de compra-venta de granos basicos; con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, doña guadalupe esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, etc. para obtener una mejor cosecha y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Guadelupe is 44 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their 6 children, who are currently studying. She has worked in agriculture for several years. Her main crop is corn. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the grain storage silos shown in the photograph. She then sells it to the agencies that buy and sell basic grains. With the income she earns from her sales she is able to cover some of the household expenses. Guadelupe is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, manure, etc. so she can have a better harvest and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, manure, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Don jose de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 17 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos basicos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don jose solicita un credito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes , herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas asi como muestra la fotografia para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
José, 48, lives in his own house with his life partner and his son, 17, who currently attends school.

He has made a living growing corn and beans for several years, which has given him the experience he needs to take care of his crops.  He sells his crops in the basic grain markets.  With the profits from his sales he's able to pay the household expenses.

José's requesting a loan to be able to buy the inputs he needs, such as fertilizer, herbicide, soil amendments, and other things to have good harvests, as seen in the photograph.

This way he'll be able to earn better profits and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, soil amendments, etc.

loans.name: 3.14.286.01.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vinh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Vinh is 61 years old, and she is married with one child.

Vinh is the group leader of the 3.14.286.01.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents; her child is grown up.

In 2012, Vinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vinh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Vinh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vinh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He aims to uplift their status of living in order to give his family a better life. To make a living, he cultivates their farm land by planting rice and some vegetables for sale. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he also engages in raising fingerlings to earn additional income. He plans to acquire more fingerlings to raise, but he has inadequate capital. Therefore, he is asking for an additional 24,000 Philippines pesos to buy fish feed and additional fingerlings to raise. Through this financial assistance, he believes that he will be going to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy fish feed and additional fingerlings to raise.

loans.name: Sophen's Group

texts.en:
Sophen is a 34-year-old mother of three children living in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district, Cambodia. Out of her three children, she still has one son who is in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for almost 14 years. The current business earns her about 28,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

This is the first microloan for Sophen’s group of two with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sophen will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living and keep her son in school until graduation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sien

texts.en: Sien, 40, is a resident living in Prey Chor district. He is married and has five children, four of whom are under his burden. Together with his wife, he raises rice on a parcel of land, where he is gaining daily income to support the family. It was his parents who taught him to work in agriculture. Sien has worked very hard because he wanted to save some money to expand his business and therefore, increase the income. He wants to have more land to grow more, because his crop is for family consumption and also for sale. Due to inadequate capital, he's requesting a loan from HKL to buy a piece of land for planting additional crops. This way, he'll have enough money to buy farmland to keep growing the business and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for planting additional crops.

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
This is Normita. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Normita would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Normita's profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Normita dreams of continuous success in her business and hopes to have a stable life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Restetuta

texts.en: Restetuta is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents). Restetuta has a restaurant business, and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes. Restetuta works from home and sells on a retail basis only. She generates additional income through making baskets. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Restetuta aspires to own a full restaurant and also to get enough profits so as to buy her own plot and build a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en: Mrs. Oyuntuya, 46 years old, lives in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her husband and son work in Korea on employment contracts. Oyuntuya has been running an automobile-sales business for three years. Her husband and son send automobiles on a container and when the container comes to Mongolia, Oyuntuya  receives and later sells the automobiles to local people. She is requesting a loan of 6500000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, a low pressure heater, hardwood floors and fiberglass. Installing these items into the house, means she will live in a comfortable and warm place. The renovated apartment will reduce heat loss greatly, thus saving energy. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass for her house.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is 27 years old. He is single. He has been a farmer for the past four years. With the loan Anastase wants to pay for the labor costs involved during cleaning of the harvests needed for the sale of the quality products. Anastase will use the profits to reinvest in the same business for the better future of the business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for the labor costs involved for cleaning the harvest that is needed for the quality sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is in her late forties and married with 3 children, aged between 15 and 27. She runs a palm oil business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She has two children that are going to school. She started this business to have her daily bread.

Elizabeth has been in this business since 2010, and sells palm oil within her surrounding environs. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run a business to her desire.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to change her business to selling assorted drinks and pure water. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her business and educate her children. In the future, she would like to have a big provision shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to change her business to selling assorted drinks and pure water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Nyame's  Group

texts.en:
This group consists of five partners, all from Dansoman. They are Beatrice, Margaret, Eunice, Lydia and Victoria. They sell jeans, smoked fish, fried fish, kenkey, and fresh fish respectively. They have been a group together since 2012. 

Beatrice is a 28-year-old jeans seller. She needs GHS 900 to buy one bale of jeans to sell to her customers.
She has been in this business for the past four years and is doing very well. She is very loyal and truthful with the loans she took from ID Ghana, and now she is applying for her third loan to meet her customers’ demands. 

The entire group needs an amount totaling GHS 3,900 to expand and buy more goods to meet the demand of their respective customers.

loans.use: To buy one bale of jeans to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eagle Group

texts.en:
Arcelita is the featured borrower of Eagle's group. She went along with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their country to work as housekeepers here in Lebanon.
Arcelita is the second from the left. She is a 51-year-old married woman, and mother of three children. Her applied for loan will be sent to her family in the Philippines to cover part of their school fees. 
Jackelyn is a 33-year-old married woman, mother of two. She is the first from the right; her applied for loan will be sent to her family in the Philippines to pay for her children's school fees. 
Rosalyn is the first from the left. She is a 37-year-old married woman, mother of two children, and she is working hard as a housekeeper to provide them with the best education ever. Her applied for loan will be also invested in paying for education fees.
Irene is a 44-year-old married woman, mother of two, and her loan will be sent to her family in the Philippines, to pay for her children's school needs.

loans.use: To send money for children's school fees back in the Philippines.

loans.name: Saydah

texts.en: Saydah is 39 years old, and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is living together  with her fiancé and 14-year-old child who is in school. Unfortunately Saydah is a junior high school dropout, but she manages her business well. Since the year 2000 she has been selling fashion clothes in the local market. Saydah started this business with money given to her by her oldest brother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses the bus to get her goods at her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes such as blouses, jean trousers, T-shirts etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and own a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes such as blouses, jean trousers, T-shirts etc. for her business

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en: Clementina says that the previous loans helped her buy more food items like maize flour, and many more. She built a house for her kids at home and now she is taking another loan to continue increasing her business stock and capital. She is happy for the loans.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is 42 years old. He is married with five children who are all aged between one and fourteen years. He has been a maize farmer for the past 21 years, and his wife is a farmer as well. With the loan, he wants to pay for the labor costs involved during cleaning the harvests to produce quality products for sale. The profits from the business will be used to help set up his family's basic needs. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for the labor costs involved during cleaning the harvests for the quality sales.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with five children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Sarah has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 7 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Sarah generates additional income from hiring out a motorcycle and also from rental rooms. She works seven days every week and sells on both retail and wholesale at the market. Her major business challenges include transportation of bags of charcoal, rainy season which hinders her movements, and defaulters. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation, and also to start investing in cattle farming. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Myeenne

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Myeenne, she is in her early forties and from Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children who are aged between 8 and 14 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

Mayeene runs a soft drinks business within her environment; she sells different kinds of drinks. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. Mayeene says that the main challenges to her business are improper business location and lack of finance to expand her business.

Mayeene has requested a loan in order to purchase more assorted drinks for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she plans to change her business to a palm oil seller. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks for resale.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 27-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and three daughters in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Asma has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store, to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Asma and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to sell.

loans.name: Oyniso

texts.en: Oyniso is 40 years old. She lives in a village with her husband and 3 children. The family gathers their main income from farming; they cultivate potatoes, beans, and grow fruit trees. She has been busy with farming for more than 10 years. Her husband helps her with business. Oyniso sells her goods at the local market. Little by little with the passing years, she has perfected her knowledge about business. Oyniso's skills and knowledge help to develop her business. She wants to develop her business further and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 2000 USD to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with seven children and all of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (nephews). She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years, selling to all types of people but on retail basis only. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of sugar, bags of bread, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, 100kg of rice, maize flour, and cooking oil. She works in a shop seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation of commodities from Kampala city to her shop and also the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked shop and also to buy a delivery van to ease transportation. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, 100kg of rice, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en:
Tofig is 49 years old. He has a wife and two children aged 15 and 18.

Tofig works in a dairy factory as a milk carter. He also works in agriculture. He is engaged in livestock breeding. Tofig likes the agriculture business and is interested in buying and reselling sheep. He has 19 years experience in this area. Besides, in the courtyard of his house, there is a barn for livestock, and the livestock market is not far from his home.

In order to purchase more yearling sheep, Tofig applied for a loan with an aim to fatten and resell them. He plans to spend the income from the business to refurbish his house.

loans.use: To purchase more yearling sheep

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 42  years old, and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with six children between 21 to 28 years. Unfortunately Oretha did not go to school, but she is good at managing her business well. For the past ten years she has been selling cassava and coconuts in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, who is not working now. Oretha enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her table. Oretha is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava and coconuts for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and coconuts for her business

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem, aged 50, is engaged in a farming and selling business. From her store in front of her house, Nhem sells vegetables and some types of grocery items, where she makes a net profit of KHR 20,000 each day. She is married with four children, two of whom help her in the businesses. Her husband financially supports the household with his profession of playing traditional Khmer instruments at wedding parties.

Nhem wants to add more merchandise to her store but she doesn't have enough money. For this reason she is taking a loan to buy grocery items, vegetables, and meat for sale. She hopes that, through the purchase, she will satisfy her customer’s needs and have a good profit.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, vegetables, and meat for sale.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El señor Agustín vive en la población de Bulo Bulo, juntamente con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el señor trabaja dedicándose al área agrícola en terrenos alquilados, cultiva zapallo y yuca. En cuanto a su producción lo vende al mercado de su población, esta actividad de producción de zapallo le genera buenos ingresos económicos por la buena demanda de la hortaliza en el mercado dicha razón por lo que el señor Agustin quiere ampliar este rubro,  por lo cual solicita el presente crédito para realizar la plantación de dos hectáreas de este cultivo (zapallo), por lo que solicita 10.000 bs, para comprar la semilla, pagar a la mano de obra y empezar con la plantación así el señor Agustin podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos cada vez más y su condición de vida, y además podrá ser capaz de cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en: Agustín lives in the town of Bulo Bulo with his wife and three children. We works as a farmer growing squash and cassava on rented land. He sells his crop in the market in his town. His squash crop generates good income for him because of the strong demand for this vegetable in the market. For this reason, Agustín would like to increase the size of his squash crop. He is requesting this loan to plant two hectares (about five acres) of squash. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 BOB to buy seeds, to pay for the labor and to begin the planting. Agustín says that with this loan he will be able to improve his income and his quality of life, and that he will be able to meet his objectives.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to pay for the labor to plant squash.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan is a 34-year-old married woman and has three school-aged children. She lives with her spouse and children in the peaceful village of Prey Chor district, where she is operating a farming business, raising rice crops to generate a livelihood and financially support her family. She has been engaged in agriculture for more than 20 years. 

Kan saved some money to purchase a farm animal but has insufficient funds, which is why she is taking out a loan in the amount of 150 US dollars to add to her savings to buy a cow. She hopes that with the help of Kiva lenders and HKL, her operating costs will be reduced and will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: La Sra. Casilda es de estado civil soltera, tiene 48 años de edad, solo tiene una hija que vive independiente por lo cual se encuentra sola en una vivienda en anticrético, ella realiza la producción de polleras que utilizan las cholitas de la ciudad. Es muy responsable con su trabajo y actualmente está prosperando económicamente, compro hace algunos años un automóvil el cual lo usa para transportarse y también hace trabajar como taxi para ganar un poco más de ingresos, pero por el desgaste la movilidad  ya necesita de mantenimiento y reparaciones ya que es un modelo antiguo que necesita cambio de llantas, motor y otros arreglos que solicita cancelar con el presente crédito, por lo cual se le pretende ayudar ya que no falla como persona, y tiene ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
Casilda is a single mother, she is 48 years old, and her daughter lives independently. She lives alone in a rented home and she makes skirts that the city's Cholitas use (Cholitas are members of a Bolivian social and political indigenous movement).  She is very responsible with her work and she is prospering economically.  

A few years ago she bought a car that she uses for her own transportation and also for a taxi service so that she can make more income.  Because of wear and tear, she needs to do general maintenance and make repairs.  It is an old model and so she already needs to change the tires, replace the motor, and other things like this.  She is seeking a loan so that she can make these repairs and continue being successful, as she wants to overcome all obstacles.

loans.use: to maintain and repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Zaida Rosalia

texts.es: Zaida Rosalía, tiene 26 años de edad, ella es madre soltera tiene dos hijos, quiere independizarse de su familia para tener su propio negocio venta de comida, para  ello necesita mucha ayuda económica es por eso que solicita crédito, actualmente vive con sus padres, Zaida no pudo continuar con sus estudios por motivo de problemas familiares cuando estaba en segundo de secundaria tuvo su hijo desde ahí ella empieza otra vida según la entrevista realizada solo le quedaba trabajar para salir adelante, entonces sus padres también ya no le ayudaron en sus estudios.  Pero la señora es trabajadora, responsable lo comentan sus amigas y vecinos de la zona donde vive.Por ahora se dedica a coadyuvar a su madre en la cocina, Rosalía se levanta muy temprano para ganarse el pan de cada día, viene por  primera vez a nuestra institución por comentarios  de sus amigas y vecinos de la zona, necesita  mucha ayuda económica para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Zaida Rosalía is 26 years old and a single mother with two children. She would like to become independent from her family and have her own business selling prepared food. She says she needs a lot of help economically to accomplish this, and it is for this reason that she is requesting this loan.

Zaida currently lives with her parents. She says that she was not able to continue her studies for family reasons. She had her son when she was in her second year of secondary school, and she says that from that moment she started a different life. She says her only option was to work to get ahead, because at that time her parents did not help her with her studies. But she says she is hardworking and responsible, and that her friends and neighbors always say this. At the moment she works helping her mother in the kitchen. She says she rises very early each day to put food on her family’s table. She came to the field partner for the first time because of what she had heard from friends and neighbors, and because she says she needs a lot of help economically to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment and accessories to start her own business selling prepared food.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña maria de 32  años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicado en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocido por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que tendrá una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children in their own home.  She owns a store where she sells necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items like these. She has worked in this business for many years and it has given her great sales experience, which helps her make a higher income.  Her store is located in her home and it is very well-known among her neighbors in the area.  She has many loyal customers because she always has things in stock. 

Maria wants to grow her business by investing in inventory but she doesn't have the capital.  She is seeking a loan so that she can buy inventory for her store.  She promises to pay back the loan and she is confident that this will help improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sweets, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en:
Hafiz is a 53-year-old farmer. 

His parents used to work in the fields from morning until the evening, seven days a week. As a child, Hafiz saw that and knew that he will work on a farm one day like his father, because even though the family was poor and faced financial hardship, they were also happy.

He is married and has two children. For the past 21 years he has been involved in raising cattle and smaller livestock. In addition to this activity, he also works on a farm. His wife helps him by producing and selling his own dairy products at home.

With a growing family and more needs to meet, Hafiz would like to increase his business. This is why he has turned to Kiva partner VFAC to purchase additional yearling sheep.

loans.use: to purchase additional yearling sheep.

loans.name: Blanca Claudia

texts.es:
Blanca, solicita un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer más el negocio  y obtener mejores ingresos; este le permitirá comprar productos básicos tales como: gaseosas, jugos, productos para elaborar la comida, aceite, carnes, pollo, tomates, cebollas, chiles, condimentos, entre otros. 
El crédito anterior le ha ayudado a aumentar las ganancias y esto ha logrado aportar más para sus hijos; las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que le permitió comprar una mesa pupusera para atender mejor a los clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca is seeking a new loan so that she can support her business and make a bigger income.  It will help her buy basic products such as soft drinks, juices, and ingredients to prepare dishes, such as oil, meat, chicken, tomatoes, onions, chili, condiments, and more.

Her previous loan has helped her increase her income and has also helped her better support her children.  Their economic conditions have improved, as she was already able to buy a pupusa table (pupusas are a traditional dish is El Salvador made from thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, pork, chicken, or refried beans) so that she could better server her customers.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, and ingredients to make dishes such as oil, meat, chicken, tomatoes, onions, chilies, condiments, and others.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastian, de 52 años, es un hombre muy luchador y no le teme a los retos que le pone la vida en su camino, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, vive en su casa propia, es por ellos que trabaja mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.Sebastian tiene como fuente de ingresos económicos la compra y venta de productos comestibles entre los que se encuentran: arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras y más. Tiene un vehículo con el cual se traslada diariamente desde muy temprano por las calles de la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos. Recorre las zonas más alejadas de la ciudad. Lleva trabajando por 5 años en este rubro. Al inicio tuvo la ayuda de su esposa pero ahora trabaja con un amigo.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además vende a precios cómodos, espera poder seguir surgiendo y hacer crecer su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe.Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería conformada por arroz, azúcar, leche, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Sebastián, 52, is a fighter and is not afraid of all the obstacles he finds on the way. He is married and has three children, and he works hard in order to give them a better quality of life. They all live in a house of their own.

To generate income, Sebastián buys and sells food products such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil and vegetables. He owns a vehicle in which he travels throughout the city offering his products even in the most remote corners, starting early in the morning.

Sebastián has had this business for five years. In the beginning, his wife helped him, but she is now working with a friend. What Sebastián likes about his job is that it leaves him time to do other activities that pop up now and then. He does well, fortunately, and he has a good customer base due to the wide assortment he offers and his good prices. He hopes to continue growing and to expand his business.

This time, Sebastián is requesting 1000 nuevos soles [PEN]. He feels grateful for the financial support he receives. He will buy supplies such as rice, sugar, milk and oil.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Ivania Jamilett

texts.es: Ivania, es una joven emprendedora, soltera de oficio comerciante, vive en la ciudad de Granada, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería, actividad que realiza desde hace dos años, con apoyo de su mama, debido a su humilde situación económica no pudo seguir estudiando. Pero eso no la ha desmotivado, siempre lucha cada día por superarse y salir adelante con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. Hoy está requiriendo el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, leña, huevo, detergente, jabón etc. El crédito le permitirá comprar más productos que le solicitan a diario sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ivania is an enterprising young woman. She is single and works in trade. She lives in the city of Granada and has owned a small grocery store for two years with the support of her mother. Due to her humble financial circumstances, she was unable to continue studying, but that did not discourage her. She fights every day to improve herself and move forward with her business to improve her quality of life. 

She needs this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, firewood, eggs, detergent, soap, etc. This loan will allow her to buy more products that her clients order on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, firewood, eggs, detergent, soap, etc.

loans.name: Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache Group

texts.es: Jovita integra el grupo “SEÑOR DE LA ESPERNZA DE HUARIPACHE” es conviviente con 3 hijos aun menores. Jovita se dedica a la ganadería y a la venta de leche y queso hace varios años. En la actualidad tiene un nuevo proyecto que consiste en la elaboración de Yogurt Natural. El préstamo lo invertirá lo en la compra de insumos: leche en polvo, azúcar y envases para elaborar yogurt natural. Una vez elaborado su yogurt natural  los ofrecerá a sus clientes y a las bodegas comerciales. Su mayor deseo es tener un puesto comercial. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Jovita es la segunda persona del lado derecho. De la misma manera está incluida Yajaira  en la parte superior derecho llego tarde a la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
Jovita is a member of the "Señor de la Esperanza de Huaripache" group. She lives with her partner and has three young children. 

Jovita has been working in livestock as well as selling milk and cheese for several years. She currently has a new project, which is making natural yogurt. She will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients (milk powder, sugar, and containers) to make natural yogurt. Once she has made the yogurt, she will offer it to her clients and to stores. Her greatest wish is to have a stall for her business. 

This group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their loan. Jovita is the second person from the right. Yajaira's photo is inserted in the top right. She was late to the meeting for work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy milk powder, sugar, and containers.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo más capital de trabajo en el cultivo y por la buena atención que la Institución le brinda; este le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo para realizar el cultivo, lo único que le afecto el ambiente climático, ya que hubo escasez de lluvia; las condiciones económicas no han mejorado, espera que en esta inversión cambien.
texts.en:
José is applying for a new loan due to his need to continue investing more working capital in his crops and the good service which the institution has given him. This loan will help him to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide, among others. 

His previous loan helped him to plant his crops. The only thing that affected him was the climate, because there was little rain. His financial circumstances have not improved, but he hopes that they will change with this investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide, among others.

loans.name: Dúo Estrellas De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Estrellas de Santo Tomas
Este dúo está conformado por doña Clemencia Jiménez, ella tiene 42 años de edad tres hijos a su cargo dos niños que aun estudian en la escuelita y su hija de 15 años quien estudia diversificado en Santa Lucia, se dedica a la venta de tortillas los tres tiempos de comida de lunes a domingo, y los días sábados se dedica a la venta de tamales, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su negocio, en especial para la compra de 10 quintales de maíz porque de esa manera ahorra un poco ya que comprándolo por quintal le sale mas barato, y sobre todo para la inversión de gas, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Duó Estreallas of Santo Tomas
This duo is comprised of Clemencia Jiménez who is 42 years old and has 3 children in her care, 2 little boys who are still in elementary school and her 15 year old daughter who is studying in Santa Lucia. She works selling tortillas during the 3 meal times, Monday through Sunday. On Saturdays, she sells tamales. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business, particularly to buy 10 quintals of corn and, in this way, to save a little as buying in quintals is cheaper. And, above all, she will buy gas. She hopes that you will be able to help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary, de 20 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de superación, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre junto a sus hermanos.Mary se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, aguas envasadas,néctares y jugos. De manera periódica llega hasta su local la empresa distribuidora para hacer entrega del pedido de sus productos de acuerdo al consumo generado. Tiene una congeladora en donde acondiciona cada una de las bebidas que ofrece. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una esquina muy concurrida de su zona lo cual le permite tener clientes constantemente. Lleva en esta actividad 6 meses y le va muy bien. Ocasionalmente trabaja como empleada del hogar lavando ropa, cocinando o cuidando niños, 
Lo que le agrada de su actividad es la rapidez con la que consigue vender sus productos, aunque esto depende del clima ya que en días calurosos el consumo se incrementa debido al sofocante calor, mientras que en días lluviosos la demanda disminuye considerablemente. A pesar de ello continúa trabajando y espera consolidar una empresa distribuidora de bebidas que sea reconocida en su sector.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando.Con el monto solicitado comprará una mayor cantidad de bebidas gasificadas y aguas envasadas.
texts.en:
20 year old Mary is a hardworking woman who wants to overcome challenges. She is single and does not have children. She lives in her mother's house along with her siblings. Mary works selling sodas, bottled water, juice drinks, and juices. The company that distributes the drinks delivers to her establishment regularly and meets orders that are based on what has been consumed. She has a fridge where she stores all the drinks that she offers. Her business can be found on a very busy corner, which enables her to always have customers. She has been running this business for 6 months, and it is going very well. She occasionally works in people's homes, washing clothes, cooking, or caring for children.
What she likes about her work is the speed at which she has managed to sell her products. However, this is dependent on the climate as on hot days the consumption of drinks increases because of the suffocating heat while on rainy days the demand decreases considerably. Despite this, she keeps working and hopes to have a drink distribution company that is recognized in the industry. At this time, she is requesting $200 and she is grateful to all the people who offer her this opportunity to access the financing she needs to keep working. She will use the amount she is requesting to buy a greater quantity of sodas and bottled water.

loans.use: to buy sodas and and bottled water.

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: El grupos “LAS TALENTOSAS” está conformado por 8 socios emprendedores quienes se encuentran pasando el ciclo 9. Maria tiene 34 años es conviviente con una hija de 7 años. Dedicada a la venta de productos de belleza hace 5 años viene realizando dicha actividad. Los sábados trabaja en una ferretería como atención al público. Su mayor deseo es tener su casa propia. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Maria es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en: The group The Talented Ones is comprised of 8 entrepreneurial members who are in their 9th loan cycle. Maria is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has a 7 year old daughter. She works selling beauty products and has been doing this for 5 years. On Saturdays, she works in a hardware store, serving the public. Her greatest wish is to have her own house. She will use the loan to buy beauty products. The group is grateful to the KIVA lenders for offering them the loan. Maria is the first on the right side.

loans.use: IN THE PURCHASE OF BEAUTY PRODUCTS

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su madre, su esposa y su hija de 1 año d edad el se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace varios años eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abonos, herbicidas, fertilizantes asi como muestra la fotografía para seguir con su cosecha pues esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi el podrá seguir llevando el pan diario a su hogar y solventar todos los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en: The client lives in his own house with his mother, his wife, and his 1 year old daughter. He has worked in agriculture for some years and this has given him the experience necessary to attend to his crops. He is able to pay the household expenses with the income that he makes from his sales. He is soliciting a loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and herbicides to use as in the photo for his crops as this is his only source of work and this will enable him to keep putting the daily bread on the table and cover all the expenses that come up.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, and herbicide.

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es: Don Medardo de 70 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 40 años su principal siembra es la yuca, tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es de muy buena calidad, el vive en casa propia con su esposa quien le ayuda en la venta de las yucas, don Medardo esta solicitando un credito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas para poder tener una mejor cosecha de yuca asi como muestra la fotografía y el podrá seguir con sus cosechas y sus ventas y asi tendrá una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Medardo is 70 years old, and he has worked in agriculture for more than 40 years. His main crop is yuca. He has a lot of customers, since his product is of very good quality. He lives in his own house with his wife, who helps him sell the yuca. Medardo is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can buy fertilizers, compost and herbicides. This will help him have a better yuca harvest, as shown in the photograph, and he will be able to continue with his harvests and his sales, and thus have better economic stability with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Sani's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2011. They are Samuel, Florence, Elizabeth and Eunice. They are an auto mechanic, cosmetician, charcoaler and hairdresser respectively. They reside in the Dansoman community. ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Samuel is a 36-years-old auto mechanic. He has 15 years experience in his business. He works 6 days in a week (from Monday to Saturday). He is constantly working to improve on his business capital. This is his 5th loan with ID-Ghana and he is requesting the an amount of GHS 2,000 to buy car batteries to sell to his customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 4,800 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy car batteries to sell to his customers in the community.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su compañero de vida en casa de un familiar, ella se dedica  a la venta de todo tipo de ropa. Blusas, camisas, suéteres, chumpas, etc. desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico donde circulan muchas personas, tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio sus productos, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comparar ropa por mayor y asi surtir su negocio con mucha mas variedad al gusto del cliente y ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su esposo.
texts.en: This borrower lives with her life partner in the home of a family member. She has worked for several years selling all types of clothing: blouses, shirts, sweaters, jackets, etc. Her business is located in a very strategic area, where many people circulate. She has a lot of customers since she sells her products at a good price. The borrower is requesting a loan so that she can buy clothing on a wholesale basis and thus stock her business with a much greater variety that will please her customers. In this way she will be able to obtain better earnings, so that she can have better economic stability with her husband.

loans.use: to buy clothing on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out repairs and general maintenance on his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Dona Af2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DONA AF2 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies du quartier et qui font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, nommée Houénoumè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houénoumè est âgée de 53 ans. Houénoumè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Houénoumè est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Houénoumè vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Houénoumè vend des bois de chauffage, des feuilles d'emballage pour akassa( pâte fait à base de maïs) par la méthode distribution depuis dix ans. Houénoumè s’approvisionne dans un un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Houénoumè sollicite un autre crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DONA AF2.
texts.en: The Dona AF2 group is made up of 3 friends who live in the same area and are part of the same mutual funds groups. The group's representative, Houénoumè, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Houénoumè is 53 years old and did not go to school. Houénoumè is married to Louis. The couple have 2 children, one of whom attends school. Houénoumè lives with her husband and children. The couple both take care of the household expenses. In order to do this, Houénoumè has been selling firewood and packaging leaves for akassa (a maize paste) via the distribution channel for 10 years. Houénoumè gets her supplies at markets in Benin and Nigeria. In order to satisfy her clientèle and increase her sales and revenue, Houénoumè is requesting a new loan together with the other members of the Dona AF2 group.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Wangninangbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINANGBE 1 est composé de trois personnes qui font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, Sonagnon Marguerite est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sonagnon Marguerite est âgée de 48 ans. Sonagnon Marguerite n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Sonagnon Marguerite est veuve. Sonagnon Marguerite a deux enfants à sa charge. Sonagnon Marguerite vit seule avec les enfants. Sonagnon Marguerite assure seule les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Sonagnon Marguerite vend du riz, du vin de palme et des bassines en aluminium à son domicile depuis vingt ans. Sonagnon Marguerite s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sonagnon Marguerite sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINANGBE 1, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Wangninangbe 1 group is made up of 3 people who are part of the same mutual funds groups. The group's representative, Sonagnon Marguerite, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Sonagnon Marguerite is 48 years old and did not go to school. Sonagnon Marguerite is a widow and is raising 2 children. Sonagnon Marguerite lives alone with the children and takes care of the household expenses by herself. In order to do this, Sonagnon Marguerite has been selling rice, palm wine and aluminium bowls from her home for 20 years. Sonagnon Marguerite gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her clientèle and increase her sales and revenue, Sonagnon Marguerite is requesting, together with the other members of the Dona AF2 group, a 5th loan from ALIDé. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm wine and aluminium bowls.

loans.name: Eddy Ricardo

texts.es:
Eddy es un hombre de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, tiene 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama a pesar que no estar cerca a ellos, ya que por diversas circunstancias se separo de su pareja, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus pequeños; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Eddy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eddy trabaja como maestro constructor, realizando diversas obras, mejoras de viviendas, locales y otras construcciones, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Eddy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de tablas de madera, las cuales le servirán de mucho para poder utilizarlas en sus construcciones, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un empresario de éxito.
texts.en:
Eddy is a 23-year-old young man who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. Eddy is separated from his partner, with whom he has two small children he loves even though he is not close to them. Eddy is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who devotes himself completely to helping his children get ahead. Unfortunately, due to financial hardship, Eddy had to begin working at an early age and was not able to study Civil Engineering like he had hoped to. 

In his free time, Eddy likes to play soccer with his friends and, on special occasions, he cooks the delicious Arroz con Pollo (a chicken and rice dish) to share with his family. 

By his own initiative and with much dedication and determination, Eddy works as a master builder on a variety of jobs, improving houses, businesses and other buildings. He works about 10 hours a day and believes that he has been successful thus far due to his work ethic and the kind way he treats others. 

Eddy is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support of this loan offered to him to buy wood, which he needs for his work. Eddy will continue working hard toward his dream of becoming the owner of a successful business.

loans.use: to buy wood boards.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is 58 years old. She is married and is raising two dependent children. In order to provide the family with all the necessary facilities, Hang started a business buying and selling clothing in the surrounding areas of Reussey Keo district. She has a large number of customers and usually makes a net income of 8 US dollars a day. Hang is applying for a loan of 1,000 US dollars to buy a motorcycle to assist her in transporting her clothing to the markets and to use for household purposes. She is awaiting your kindness and promises to repay the loan on time as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help her transport her clothing to the markets and to use for household purposes.

loans.name: Bekmurod

texts.en: Bekmurod is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Being a responsible father, Bekmurod works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs and send some of his children to school. He has been dedicated for the past 15 years to farming, growing crops and vegetables on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards, he works hard from early morning till late evening. Bekmurod would like to develop his business, which is why he is applying for a loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. He hopes that KIVA lenders won’t reject his loan, and he thanks the lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season.

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en: Lusik is a very charming woman who lives in her small flat in the Vanadzhor in the region of Lori. She is a widow. Lusik has a small family, a daughter and a son. She lives alone, since her husband is departed, her son is in the Russian Federation, and her daughter is married and lives with her own family. Lusik has a trading business in her small private market. She brings the clothes that she sells from Yerevan, and sometimes from Turkey, in a rented car. She has been in the trading business for about fifteen years, and she has a great deal of experience in this field. She greets customers with a smile, offers them clothes of various sizes and fashions, and offers prices that are as cheap as possible. As a result, Lusik has many regular customers and great income from her business. Lusik wants to have a loan with Kiva and is applying for a loan of 1,100,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to buy new spring-summer fashion clothes and women’s underwear for resale in her stall. She will be very happy if Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon support her loan.

loans.use: to buy new spring-summer fashion clothes and women’s underwear to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar, a 31-year-old, is engaged in agriculture. He married very young and now has two teenage sons. Anar works in purchasing and reselling livestock. The only challenges he is facing is his business today are expensive grass and feed and the poor quality of drugs for the animals, which increases the risk that the animals will die. However, Anar is a diligent and hard-working man, able to overcome these difficulties. The reason he has applied for this loan is to cover the costs of refurbishing his house. He loves his family and wants to create a comfortable living level for them. He promises to repay the money without any delays.

loans.use: to cover the costs of refurbishment of his house.

loans.name: Most's Group

texts.en: This group consists of two members, Vida D. and Vida. One is a seamstress and the other a seller of undergarments, in their community. They have been together from 2011 to date and still doing very well. Vida, 50 years old, is the seamstress. She is married to Herbert, a 55-year-old contractor. She has three children. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and is doing very well. She has been in this business for three years. She works from Mondays to Saturdays.
